ARTICLE.TITLE: Coronavirus UK updates live as quarantine tightened, theatres reopen and cases soar
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Lockdown restrictions will be eased in England from today.

From Saturday, socially distanced audiences are allowed back into indoor venues, while wedding receptions of up to 30 people are also permitted.

Tattoo studios, beauty salons, spas and hairdressers are all able to offer additional services from Saturday too, including front of face treatments such as eyebrow threading.

Theatres, casinos and bowling alleys are also allowed to reopen from this weekend.

The lockdown restrictions were due to be eased on August 1, but a spike in coronavirus cases at the time resulted in them being paused for two weeks.

The reopening comes as Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced tougher fines for people repeatedly not wearing a mask.

People who refuse to wear a face covering where it is required previously faced a £100 fine, which can be reduced to £50 if paid within 14 days, but under the new measures, that penalty will double for subsequent offences, up to a maximum of £3,200.

Meanwhile a clampdown on illegal gatherings of more than 30 people could see those responsible hit with spot fines of up to £10,000, a No 10 source indicated.

Find the latest number of cases near you

New quarantine measures on travellers returning to or visiting the UK from France, the Netherlands, Monaco, Malta, Turks & Caicos and Aruba also come into force from 4am on Saturday.

It comes as Coronavirus cases in the UK have soared with the highest daily figure for two months according to figures on Friday. The Government announced that within a 24-hour period up until 9am on Friday (August 14), there had been 1,441 new cases of Covid-19.

The figure for positive tests is the highest daily surge since June 14, with the overall total of cases now rising to 316,367.

Hull and East Riding coronavirus case numbers have risen by 18 since Tuesday. The infection rate in the city is now 611.3 per 100,000 residents, well above the England average of 486.6. Click here to read more.

It was also announced that the number of coronavirus deaths in hospital settings in the UK had risen by nine, with a further eight recorded in England bringing the total 29,452, according to NHS England.

One further death was reported in Northern Ireland whereas both Wales and Scotland recorded zero deaths on Friday.

While the growth rate of coronavirus transmission, which reflects how quickly the number of infections is changing day by day, has changed slightly across the UK since last week, with early indications the value may be increasing. Read the full story here.

Follow live updates on the coronavirus pandemic below.

METADATA.description: The latest coronavirus news and updates from the Covid-19 pandemic
METADATA.author: Barnabas Stephenson
